function isSearch() {
    return window.location.href.match(/\/search/g)
}
function isSearchRelatedPage() {
    if(window.location.href.match(/\/job\//g)) {
        return document.referrer.match(/\/search/g);
    }

    return window.location.href.match(/\/search|\/ApplyFinish\//g)
}
</script>

        <!-- About Us -->
        <div id="jdp-about-us-section" class="hidden-sm hidden-xs">

    <!-- Left Column -->
    <div class="jdp-left-column col-md-8 col-md-pull-4">
        <!-- Job Description -->
        <div id="jdp-job-description-section">
            <div class="jdp-job-description-card content-card">
    <h2 class="content-card-header">Job Description</h2>
    <ul><li>Partner with cross functional project teams to lead product and/or process design and development activities</li><li>Lead Risk Management activities for high-volume orthopedic product launches</li><li>Evaluate overall residual risk for products prior to launch and present final risk-benefit justification to executive leadership</li><li>Present risks associated with the product use during Design Reviews and track how the design, documentation and manufacturing process mitigate risks linked to product</li><li>Partner with Product Development to define design verification and validation test requirements that will ensure appropriate objective evidence is available to support the acceptance criteria</li><li>Partner with Advanced Operations in the development of manufacturing processes for new products</li><li>Develop, review and approve inspection plans, routers and product drawings</li><li>Partner with Advanced Operations to define process and process controls and subsequently design transfer product to manufacturing</li><li>Develop quality assurance documentation to support regulatory submissions</li><li>Work with complaint investigators to complete post-market health risk assessments</li><li>Lead quality system maintenance for the division by identifying and correcting deficiencies in our procedures and practicesManage, lead and/or assist in resolving nonconformities and corrective/preventive actions (CAPA)</li><li></li></ul>
</div>

        </div>
        <!-- Job Requirements -->
        <div id="jdp-job-requirements-section">
            <div class="jdp-job-requirements-card content-card">
    <h2 class="content-card-header">Job Requirements</h2>
    <ul><li>Minimum 4-6 years of experience as a Quality Engineer (QE) in a regulated design environment. Prefer experience with capital medical device product development life cycle, including quality planning, risk management and design/ process verification & validation</li><li>Demonstrated applied knowledge of FDA QSRs, ISO 13485 Design Control Procedures and ISO 14971</li><li>Demonstrated applied knowledge of Advanced Quality tools such as Failure Modes Effect Analysis (FMEA), GD&T, Root Cause Analysis, and Mistake Proofing/Poka Yoke.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to read and interpret CAD drawings including GD&T</li><li>Demonstrated applied knowledge of statistical techniques (e.g. Gage R&R, capability analysis, Design of Experiment)</li></ul>
</div>

        </div>
        <!-- Desktop Apply Now Section-->
        <div id="jdp-bottom-apply-section">

        </div>

Director Position Summary  The Program Manager supports goTRGs strong drive for sales revenue and overall aggressive growth of the business The Program Manager will assess develop coordinate and monitor software andor supply chain projects from initiation through delivery Program Managers will be responsible for cross functional coordination between technical and non technical departments as well as between both external customers and internal business units Program Managers will ensure that all targets and requirements are met while managing customer expectations  Major Responsibilities Essential Functions Implement new programs with new and existing customersCoordinate and monitor software projects from initiation through deliveryEnsure technical projects are completed on schedule and within budgetMay work with software such as enterprise resource planning ERP customer relationship management CRM database multi media or InternetWeb applicationsConduct high level conversations and market research with Senior ExecutivesAct as liaison between technical and non technical groupsHave a technical understanding of and ability to articulate and demonstrate goTRGs product line and value propositionActively build product knowledge to ensure a high level of literacy on the goTRG systems as well as new functionalitySkills & Work Traits Cross functional and project management skillsStrong organization skillsStrong communication skillsExcellent communication skills ability to communicate effectively to engineers management and clientsDetail OrientedAbility to design and implement projects from beginning to end with the proven track record of successful projects being rolled outHigh competency in monitoring project budget and schedulePerforms other duties as assignedAbility to communicate at a high level with various internal and external parties such as clients vendors employees and executivesHighly responsible self motivated and able to work with minimal supervisionBroad knowledge of the field with proven leadership skillsMust be a hands on worker and work well with other teams and business unitsKnowledge of physical operations and production environments Technical Competencies Understanding of SaaS andor Supply Chain Knowledge of project management softwareKnowledge of Microsoft Office Word Outlook and ExcelLeadership skillsExcellent verbal and written communicationProactive self starterAbility to multi task and adapt to changing prioritiesAttention to detail with follow throughStrong administrative skillsExcellent problem solving skills Required Qualifications Minimum of 3   5 year of related experienceExperience in Supply Chain andor SaaS lifecycle and project implementation Experience in physical operations andor production environments considered and assetAbility to demonstrate project implementation and planning skills Are you performance driven and want your impact to actually matter Do you want to personally grow and use that expertise to transform your company industry and the world itself Do you want to be part of a family that works and plays together; that believes anything is possible and then goes after it At goTRG we are designing next generation applicationsSoftware and robotics to achieve more with less goTRG is Re defining basic business functions like warehouse management and resource planningPioneering new omnichannel e commerce breakthroughsInventing innovative robotics and automation toolUsing our technology to help our partners achieve greater profitability and reduce their environmental footprintgoTRG has doubled sales in the last three years we are now ramping up for serious growth We are looking for valued and passionate teammates in every functional area About goTRG goTRG is a leader in the implementation and execution of multi channel and supply chain solutions The companys innovative R1 technology powers every touch movement and decision for the worlds largest companies resulting in superior net margins controls and sell through goTRG has processed and sold 35 million units with a retail value of over 23 billion in the last year 100000 SKUs are simultaneously listed on 22 marketplaces with a retail value of over 100 million R1 has collected and curated data for over 38 million UPCs from over 50 marketplaces in the last year  "/>

	<div class="reqResult">

	
<div id='jobViewHeader'></div>	
	
		     

				
		<h2>Program Implementation Manager</h2>	
	
	
			
		<table class="viewFields">
		      			      <tr>	<td class="viewFieldName" ><b>Department:</b></td>
					<td class="viewFieldValue">Operations</td></tr>		      			      <tr>	<td class="viewFieldName"><b>Office:</b></td>
					<td class="viewFieldValue">Florida<br></td></tr>					
		      					
		      		      		      		      		      		      		</table>



<div class='applyDivContainer'><div class='applyDiv'><span class='button'><A class='applyOnline' HREF='#' onClick="window.open('https://apply.hrmdirect.com/resumedirect/ApplyOnline/Apply.aspx?req_id=600729&source=600729-JB-1014', 'App600729', 'width=1024,height=768,status=0,location=0,menubar=0,toolbar=0,directories=0,scrollbars=1,resizable=1'); return false;">START YOUR APPLICATION</A></span></div><div style='clear: both;'></div></div>


		
	
		<div class="jobDesc"><p><strong>Position:</strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Program Implementation Manager</p>
<p><strong>Department:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implementation &amp; Business Management</p>
<p><strong>Classification:</strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Salaried Non-Exempt</p>
<div>
<p><strong>Reports to:</strong>&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Director</p>
</div>
<p><strong><span>Position Summary:</span></strong><span><br> The Program Manager supports goTRGís strong drive for sales, revenue and overall aggressive growth of the business. The Program Manager will assess, develop, coordinate and monitor software and/or supply chain projects from initiation through delivery. Program Managers will be responsible for cross functional coordination between technical and non-technical departments, as well as between both external customers and internal business units. Program Managers will ensure that all targets and requirements are met, while managing customer expectations.</span></p>
<p><span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong><span>Major Responsibilities /Essential Functions:</span></strong></p>
<ul>
<li><span>Implement new programs with new and existing customers</span></li>
<li><span>Coordinate and monitor software projects from initiation through delivery</span></li>
<li><span>Ensure technical projects are completed on schedule and within budget</span></li>
<li><span>May work with software such as enterprise resource planning (ERP), customer relationship management (CRM), database, multi-media, or Internet/Web applications</span></li>
<li><span>Conduct high level conversations and market research with Senior Executives</span></li>
<li><span>Act as liaison between technical and non-technical groups</span></li>
<li><span>Have a technical understanding of and ability to articulate and demonstrate goTRGís product line and value proposition</span></li>
<li><span>Actively build product knowledge to ensure a high level of literacy on the goTRG systems as well as new functionality</span></li>
</ul>
<p><strong><span>Skills &amp; Work Traits</span></strong><span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<ul>
<li><span>Cross functional and project management skills</span></li>
<li><span>Strong organization skills</span></li>
<li>Strong communication skills</li>
<li>Excellent communication skills ability to communicate effectively to engineers, management, and clients</li>
<li>Detail-Oriented</li>
<li>Ability to design and implement projects from beginning to end with the proven track record of successful projects being rolled out</li>
<li>High competency in monitoring project budget and schedule</li>
<li>Performs other duties as assigned</li>
<li>Ability to communicate at a high level with various internal and external parties such as clients, vendors, employees and executives</li>
<li>Highly responsible, self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision</li>
<li>Broad knowledge of the field with proven leadership skills</li>
<li>Must be a hands-on worker and work well with other teams and business units</li>
<li>Knowledge of physical operations and production environments</li>
</ul>
<p><span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong><span>Technical Competencies</span></strong><span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<ul>
<li><span>Understanding of SaaS and/or Supply Chain </span></li>
<li><span>Knowledge of project management software</span></li>
<li><span>Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook and Excel)</span></li>
<li>Leadership skills</li>
<li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li>
<li>Proactive, self-starter</li>
<li>Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities</li>
<li>Attention to detail with follow-through</li>
<li>Strong administrative skills</li>
<li>Excellent problem-solving skills</li>
</ul>
<p><strong><span>&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p><strong><span>Required Qualifications:</span></strong><span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<ul>
<li><span>Minimum of 3 - 5 year of related experience</span></li>
<li><span>Experience in Supply Chain and/or SaaS lifecycle and project implementation </span></li>
<li><span>Experience in physical operations and/or production environments (considered and asset)</span></li>
<li><span>Ability to demonstrate project implementation and planning skills</span></li>
</ul>
<p><strong><span>&nbsp;</span></strong></p>
<p>Are you performance-driven and want your impact to actually matter? Do you want to personally grow and use that expertise to transform your company, industry and the world itself? Do you want to be part of a family that works and plays together; that believes anything is possible and then goes after it?</p>
<p>At goTRG, we are designing next generation applications/Software and robotics to achieve more with less.</p>
<p>goTRG is:</p>
<ul>
<li>Re-defining basic business functions like warehouse management and resource planning</li>
<li>Pioneering new omnichannel e-commerce breakthroughs</li>
<li>Inventing innovative robotics and automation tool</li>
<li>Using our technology to help our partners achieve greater profitability, and reduce their environmental footprint</li>
</ul>
<p>goTRG has doubled sales in the last three years, we are now ramping up for serious growth. We are looking for valued and passionate teammates in every functional area.</p>
<p><strong><span>About goTRG</span></strong><span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span>goTRG is a leader in the implementation and execution of multi-channel and supply chain solutions. The companyís innovative R1 technology powers every touch, movement and decision for the worldís largest companies resulting in superior net margins, controls and sell-through.</span></p>
<p><span>goTRG has processed and sold 35 million units with a retail value of over $2.3 billion in the last year. 100,000 SKUís are simultaneously listed on 22 marketplaces with a retail value of over $100 million. R1 has collected and curated data for over 38 million UPCís from over 50 marketplaces in the last year.</span></p>
<!--HTML-EMAIL--></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
function load() {
	var urllocation = location.href; //find url parameter
	if(urllocation.indexOf("#") == -1 || urllocation.indexOf("#job") > -1){
		window.location.hash="job"; 
	}
}
</script>

			$(".chzn-select").chosen();

			// for each filter with an aria-label defined, 
			// add the label to the visible chozen container element
			$('[data-aria-label]').each( function(index, hiddenSelect){
				var $hiddenSelect = $(hiddenSelect);
				var ariaValue = $hiddenSelect.data('ariaLabel');
				$hiddenSelect.siblings('.chzn-container').attr('aria-label', ariaValue);

		<script language="javascript">
			$(document).ready(function()
			{
			    $(".defaultText").focus(function(srcc)
			    {
				if ($(this).val() == $(this)[0].title)
				{
				    $(this).removeClass("defaultTextActive");
				    $(this).val("");
				}
			    });
			    
			    $(".defaultText").blur(function()
			    {
				if ($(this).val() == "")
				{
				    $(this).addClass("defaultTextActive");
				    $(this).val($(this)[0].title);
				}
			    });
			    
			    $(".defaultText").blur();        
			});
		</script>

			});	
			 
		});
		</script>

<script>
(function IIFE(dataLayer) {
	var mySearchExperience = isSearch() ? "" : window.localStorage.getItem('search_algorithm');
    var searchAlgorithm = isSearchRelatedPage() ? mySearchExperience || 'none' : 'none';
    dataLayer.push({
            "talentNetworkDID": "TNHV0NZ6JLYRVGX9JC4H",
            "companyName": "Stryker",
            "clientCountry": "US",
            "template_ID": "premium",
            "search_experience": searchAlgorithm
    });
})(window.dataLayer);


function isSearch() {
    return window.location.href.match(/\/search/g)
}
function isSearchRelatedPage() {
    if(window.location.href.match(/\/job\//g)) {
        return document.referrer.match(/\/search/g);
    }

    return window.location.href.match(/\/search|\/ApplyFinish\//g)
}
</script>

        <input id="search-keywords-field" type="text" class="search-bar-keyword-field form-control" ng-model="keywordInput"
               ng-keydown="checkKeywordKeydown($event)" placeholder="Job Title or Category">
    </div>
    <div class="search-bar-element search-field-container search-location-field">
        <label for="search-location-field" class="hidden-xs search-bar-location-label label-text">Location:</label>
        
        <input id="search-location-field" autocomplete="off" type="text" class="form-control search-bar-location-field " ng-keydown="checkLocationKeydown($event)"
               ng-model="locationInput" ng-change="getSuggestions()" placeholder="City or Postal Code">
        <ul id="suggestions" class="list-group autocomplete-list suggestions-list" role="list" ng-show="locationSuggestions.length > 0" ng-cloak>
            <li ng-repeat="location in locationSuggestions" class="blockSpan list-group-item" ng-click="addToSelectedTags($index)"
                ng-mouseover="$parent.selectedIndex=$index" ng-class="{active : selectedIndex===$index}">{{$parent.googlePlacesAutocompleteEnabled ? location.description : location}}</li>
            <li ng-repeat-end class="autocompletefooter" ng-if="googlePlacesAutocompleteEnabled"><img src='/public/cms_base/img/powered_by_google_on_white.png' align='right'class='google-footer'></li>
        </ul>
    </div>
    <div class="search-bar-element search-widget-container">
        <a ng-href="{{searchUrl()}}" id="primary-search-button" target="_top" class="search-btn primary-button text-center label-text">Search</a>

        <!-- Job Description -->
        <div id="jdp-job-description-section">
            <div class="jdp-job-description-card content-card">
    <h2 class="content-card-header">Job Description</h2>
    Are you looking for an opportunity to apply your software engineering talent in an exciting domain that is changing the future of surgery? To join a company ranked #19 on Fortune Magazine‚Äôs 100 Best Companies to Work For? (http://beta.fortune.com/best-companies/stryker-19)<br /> <br />Do you want to work with ‚Äúamazingly talented high achievers‚Äù who are ‚Äúwilling to go above and beyond with a smile on their face‚Äù to make the products that ‚Äúchange patients‚Äô lives‚Äù? To build a rewarding career with an innovative company? Join us at Stryker!<br /><br />As an application software engineer at Stryker, you will design, develop and maintain software for robotic-assisted surgery products. You will collaborate with peers in software engineering, software quality assurance, and project and product management to develop software that meets customer and system requirements. Following defined design practices and the use of sound software engineering principles, you will ensure that application software products are safe, robust, and user friendly.<br /><br /> <br /><strong>Responsibilities</strong><ul><li>Work as part of a team using established procedures for Agile Software Development</li><li>Develop new code and maintain existing code in C++ and Qt under close professional leadership</li><li>Support project leadership by participating in software planning and estimating activities</li><li>Identify root causes of issues and determine potential solutions</li><li>Participate in verification and validation activities</li><li>Follow the company‚Äôs quality process</li></ul>
</div>

        </div>
        <!-- Job Requirements -->
        <div id="jdp-job-requirements-section">
            <div class="jdp-job-requirements-card content-card">
    <h2 class="content-card-header">Job Requirements</h2>
    <ul><li>Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related</li><li>3+ years of experience in Software Development </li></ul><ul><li><strong>Required Technical Competencies:</strong> Fundamentals in algorithms and data structures; object oriented design and analysis; software design, development and verification methodologies; C++ development; use of software development tools such as compliers, interpreters, programming editors, debuggers, source code control, code review, defect management.</li></ul><ul><li><strong>Preferred Technical Competencies:</strong> Experience with Qt development; background in 3D graphics and geometry; Linux-based software development skills.</li></ul><br />
</div>

        </div>
        <!-- Desktop Apply Now Section-->
        <div id="jdp-bottom-apply-section">

function clk(a) { var hr = a.href; var si = hr.indexOf('&jsa='); if (si > 0) return; var jsh = hr + '&jsa='; a.href = jsh; }

function ptk(st,p) {
  document.cookie = 'PTK="tk=1bv03npl30m9l14b&type=viewjob&subtype='+st+(p?'&'+p:'')+'"; path=/';
}
function jsall_loaded() {
    
    initDwellPerformanceLogging('1bv03npl30m9l14b', 'jasx');
    initProcessLeftoverDwellEntries();
    
    detectBrowserState('viewjob', '1bv03npl30m9l14b');

    initWindowDwellLogging('jasx', '1bv03npl30m9l14b', 'jasxvj');

<script type="text/javascript">
	function loadJSAsync( ) {
		for ( var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++ ) {
			var url = arguments[i];
			(function() {
				var s = document.createElement("script"), el = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
				s.async = true;
				s.src = url;
				el.parentNode.insertBefore(s, el);
			})();
		}
	}
</script>
<script type="text/javascript">
    
    if (typeof window['closureReadyCallbacks'] == 'undefined') {
        window['closureReadyCallbacks'] = [];
    }

    function call_when_jsall_loaded(cb) {
        if (window['closureReady']) {
            cb();
        } else {
            window['closureReadyCallbacks'].push(cb);
        }
    }
</script>

<div id="u_nav">
    <script>

function regExpEscape(s) {
    return String(s).replace(/([-()\[\]{}+?*.$\^|,:#<!\\])/g, '\\$1').
            replace(/\x08/g, '\\x08');
}


function appendParamsOnce(url, params) {
    var useParams = params.replace(/^(\?|\&)/, '');
    if (url.match(new RegExp('[\\?|\\&]' + regExpEscape(useParams))) == null) {
        return url += (url.indexOf('?') > 0 ? '&' : '?' ) + useParams;
    }
    return url;
}

</script>

<table id="job-content" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" role="main">
   <tr valign="top"><td style="padding:20px;padding-left:23px;">

<a tabindex="-1" id="job_header"></a>
<div data-tn-component="jobHeader">
<b class="jobtitle"><font size="+1">Senior Process Engineer</font></b>

<br>
<span class="company">National Molding, LLC</span>
     -
<span class="location">Miami Lakes, FL</span>
    </div>
    <table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 border=0><tr><td class="snip">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>ONLY CANDIDATES WITH RJG SCIENTIFIC PLASTIC INJECTION MOLDING EXPERIENCE (as Process Engineer) WILL BE CONSIDERED</b></p><p><b>SUMMARY</b></p><p>Performs a variety of basic engineering task to establish processes and parameters on injection molding machines that will insure the proper functioning of equipment and productivity of products produced. Must also be committed to the highest level of quality in everything that is done. Will also be responsible for assisting production with <b><i>root</i></b> cause analysis and assuring that all documentation is correct and in the proper place.</p><p><b>MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS</b></p><ul><li>Minimum 5 years of experience in Automotive / Medical precision Injection Molding in the related field and a preferred min of 10 years within the injection molding industry.</li><li>Highly skilled in plastic injection molding process optimization using data driven metrics.</li><li>RJG MM1 Cerfication - Scientific Injection Molding (using RJG E-Dart Hardware and software) is a definite requirement to perform these duties.</li><li>Machine, Mold, Automation, Robotics and Part Handling improvement recommendations and equipment optimization to perform and achieve precision cycle times and processes.</li><li>Ability to communicate and counteract with the engineering, tooling, quality, and production departments.</li><li>Must have minimum 5 yrs experience with engineering grade materials.</li><li>Troubleshooting and Root cause analysis and identification of molding and process conditions and parameters.</li><li>Strong mathematical, analytical and problem solving skills.</li><li>Must have ability to analyze and present accurate CER with an understanding of ROI‚Äôs.</li><li>Ability to work with outside suppliers, resin manufacturers / representatives. Some customer interaction or meetings may be necessary to attend at times.</li><li>Dedicated to Continuous Improvement, Preventative Maintenance at machine and equipment.</li><li>Requirement and Ability to train other Process Technicians and support ongoing efforts in precision cycle time reduction and process capabilities. Must understand the Cpk data and process effects.</li><li>Manage and leads mold setup and process equipment setup technicians as necessary.</li></ul><p><b>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS</b></p><ul><li>Performs a variety of basic and advanced engineering tasks. Measurements and Quality control essentials</li><li>Must be capable and effective using measuring devices such as: Micrometers, Calipers, Gauges, Optical Comparator, Microscopes, Dial gauges, Bore Gauges, Pyrometers, Infrared camera.</li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situation or data requires a review of identifiable factors.</li><li>Visually inspect injection molding machine, including chillers, thermolators, dryers, and granulators to assess working conditions and operational conditions ‚Äì Snags for maintenance as necessary.</li><li>Identifies parts rejection process with proper tools and schematics dimensions, blue print, GD&T</li><li>Responds to warning signals or intervention by plan personnel to evaluate and correct problems with injection molding machines.</li><li>Initializes some repairs and adjustments to injection mold machine or contacts Maintenance Department with assessment of problem.</li><li>Checks parameters and settings of machines, calibrates, adjust or performs new auxiliary equipment process or molding machine processing parameter settings as needed.</li><li>Directs / instructs, trains personnel in scientific molding process, operation of machines, machinery and equipment safety features as required.</li><li>Reviews projection reports daily to assess problem areas and takes corrective actions to resolve problems.</li><li>Performs quality control tasks including critical part measurements, visual inspection of parts, checking lot numbers of materials, review QC reports and action reports.</li><li>Make recommendations to Supervisor / Manager on improving company processes and / or productivity, automation, robotics cycle improvement techniques.</li></ul><p><b>EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER: </b> M/F/D/V</p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Required education:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's</li></ul><p>Required experience:</p><ul><li>Scientific RJG Plastic Injection Molding: 5 years</li><li>Plastics Injection Molding: 5 years</li></ul><p>Required license or certification:</p><ul><li>RJG Master Molder 1 or above</li></ul></span><br><div id="p_e34f55fc95439637">
<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
            <div class="result-link-bar"><span class="date">30+ days ago</span> <span id="tt_set_0" class="tt_set">  -  <a id="sj_e34f55fc95439637" href="#" class="sl resultLink save-job-link " onclick="changeJobState('e34f55fc95439637', 'save', 'linkbar', false, ''); return false;" title="Save this job to my.indeed">save job</a></span><div id="editsaved2_e34f55fc95439637" class="edit_note_content" style="display:none;"></div><script>if (!window['result_e34f55fc95439637']) {window['result_e34f55fc95439637'] = {};}window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['showSource'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['source'] = "Indeed"; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['loggedIn'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['showMyJobsLinks'] = false;window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['undoAction'] = "unsave";window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['relativeJobAge'] = "30+ days ago";window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['jobKey'] = "e34f55fc95439637"; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['myIndeedAvailable'] = true; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['showMoreActionsLink'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['resultNumber'] = 0; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['jobStateChangedToSaved'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['searchState'] = ""; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['basicPermaLink'] = "https://www.indeed.com"; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['saveJobFailed'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['removeJobFailed'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['requestPending'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['notesEnabled'] = true; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['currentPage'] = "viewjob"; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['sponsored'] = false;window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['reportJobButtonEnabled'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['showMyJobsHired'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['showSaveForSponsored'] = false; window['result_e34f55fc95439637']['showJobAge'] = true;</script></div></div>

<script>
	//this function disables order by on the 'Apply' column
	function fixgrid_sal() {
		g = ColdFusion.Grid.getGridObject('job_list_grid');
		var load_Mask=new Ext.LoadMask(g.bwrap,Ext.apply({store:g.store}, g.loadMask));
		load_Mask.show();
		cols = g.getColumnModel();
		for(var i=0; i < cols.getColumnCount(); i++) {
			var thisid = cols.getColumnId(i);
			var thiscol = cols.getColumnById(thisid);
			if(thiscol.header == "Apply" || thiscol.header == "Map") thiscol.sortable = false;
		}
		g.view.emptyText = "<b>No Jobs were found with the specified search criteria</b>";
		//ColdFusion.Grid.refresh('job_list_grid', true);
	}

</script>

<div style="width: 100%">
<table  cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 align="center" style="width: 980px;margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;margin-top: 6px;margin-bottom: 6px;" class="table_cls">
	<tr>
		<td colspan="4" class="tb_header">Job Description</td>
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td class="formfieldcell" style="width: 20%">COMPANY:</td>
		<td class="forminputcell_sal" style="width: 30%">American Welding Society</td>
		<td class="formfieldcell" style="width: 20%">DATE POSTED:</td>
		<td class="forminputcell_sal" style="width: 30%">10/31/2017</td>
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td class="formfieldcell">DEPARTMENT:</td>
		<td class="forminputcell_sal">Certification</td>
		
			<td class="formfieldcell">POSITION CATEGORY:</td>
			<td class="forminputcell_sal">Manager-Exam Bank and Certification Programs</td>
		
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td class="formfieldcell">POSITION:</td>
		<td class="forminputcell_sal">Manager-Exam Bank and Certification Programs</td>
		<td class="formfieldcell">OPENINGS:</td>
		<td class="forminputcell_sal">1</td>
	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td  class="formfieldcell">LOCATION:</td>
		
		<td  class="forminputcell_sal"> Miami, FL - US<br>
						8669 NW 36 Street, #130, American Welding Society World Headquarters 33166
						<img src="img/map.png" style="cursor: pointer;"  title="Click to see the map address of the job location." alt="Job Location Address Map"
							onclick="javascript:openMapsWindow('1832504','JOBAPP','jobappl');">
		</td>
		<td class="formfieldcell">REQ #:</td>
		<td class="forminputcell_sal">1832504</td>

	</tr>
	
	<tr>
		<td class="formfieldcell">JOB DESCRIPTION</td>
		
		<td colspan="3" class="forminputcell_sal">
			<div style="width: 100%; height: 210px;overflow:auto">
				
				<div style="margin-top: 15px;font-family: Verdana,Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;font-size: 11px;font-weight: normal;vertical-align: middle;white-space: normal;padding-right:10px;">
					<p>    Summary:</p><p>    The American Welding Society (AWS) is a 70,000 member strong organization    based in Miami, Florida. AWS was founded in New York in 1919 as a    multifaceted, nonprofit organization with the goal of advancing the    science, technology, and application of welding. AWS offers many    certification programs to assist industry in identifying qualified welding    personnel and to provide opportunities for welding professionals to    demonstrate their qualifications to the welding industry. The premier AWS    certification program is the Certified Welding Inspector (CWI) program.    Established in 1976, over 95,000 welding inspectors have been certified and    approximately 45,000 are currently certified. This program has been a major    contributor to improved weld quality and reduced production costs. AWS    offers additional certification programs for welding supervisors,    engineers, radiographic interpreters, educators, sales representatives,    robotic arc welding operators, and welders.</p><p>    Reports To:</p><p>    Managing Director, Certification Department</p><p>    Reports To:</p><p>    (1) Administrative Assistant, Certification</p><p>    Job Summary:</p><p>    The Manager of Exam Bank and Certification Programs will be responsible for    overseeing the full cycle of certification scheme development, exam    development, exam and program maintenance, and evaluation of exam    performance. This work will involve cooperation with and direction of    volunteer committees of subject matter experts. The goal will be to    maintain the high level of integrity and reputation of the existing    programs, and to improve the development, maintenance, and assessment    functions were possible.</p><p>    Position Functions:</p><p>    * Oversee the development, maintenance, and performance of all AWS    personnel certification programs</p><p>    * Manage volunteer committees responsible for personnel certification    programs</p><p>    * Assist/guide subject matter experts in the development of exam bank    questions</p><p>    * Manage quality control program and documents for all AWS personnel    certification programs</p><p>    * Participate in national and international committee activity with    personnel certification standards setting organizations (e.g., ANSI, ISO)</p><p>    Responsibilities:</p><p>    * Work with volunteer committees to develop and maintain personnel    certification program requirements which include the following activities:</p><ul><p>    o For new programs, lead or participate in subject matter expert task    groups through JTA process for target personnel certification program</p><p>    o For existing programs, reevaluate existing program requirements and    participate in subject matter expert JTA task groups to modify requirements</p><p>    o Serve as committee secretary to exam bank committees to assist in the    development of exam bank questions and new tests, and review the    performance of current exam bank questions</p><p>    o Participate in the development of personnel qualification standards and    personnel certification standards</p><p>    o Assist the exam bank subcommittee in defining the KSAs for exam questions</p></ul><p>    * Review and analysis the results of certification tests with the goals of:</p><ul><p>    o Identifying breaches of exam security</p><p>    o Identifying questions and test components not performing within designed    performance parameters</p><p>    o Summarizing exam and question performances for review by exam bank    committee</p></ul><p>    * Develop and validate specific exam versions to be used or determine the    specific exam delivery methods to be used</p><p>    * Manage the contracting and receipt of exam material to be translated into    foreign languages including developing and securing confidentiality    agreements with translators</p><p>    * Support Certification Operations with their administration and    implementation of the certification programs:</p><ul><p>    o Provide advice and guidance to certification on development of    administrative documents, e.g., applications, test instructions</p><p>    o Provide advice and guidance on the development of test supervisor    instructions</p><p>    o Assist operations staff with resolving irregularities in scoring</p><p>    o Assist with the development of Certification Operation's quality control    procedures that affect exam security and exam integrity</p></ul><p>    * Support Managing Director, Certification on departmental projects such    as:</p><ul><p>    o Design and choice of delivery system of exams</p><p>    o Evaluation and choice of third party testing agencies</p></ul><p>    * Work with Database Administrator to maintain and improve existing    scoring, analysis, and archiving of test results</p><p>    * Be the principle architect in the transition from paper-based classical    testing to computer based item response testing</p><p>    * Assist in developing test proctoring policies and control documents</p><p>    * Continuously evaluate systems in order to obtain best psychometric    results</p><p>    * Review of old and new IT systems, including Scantron paper based result    files, and Prometric computer based testing results, including exam    performance and candidate experience.</p><p>    * Unify all key elements of data and make recommendations on how key data    should be stored, maintained, and accessed in a new CRM environment</p><p>    * Ensure all job duties are carried out while reducing cost</p><p>    * Resolve or assist in resolving exam administration issues or    nonconformities</p><p>    * Respond to candidate inquiries pertaining to their exam performance and    how to interpret their score reports</p><p>    * Work with committee members of subject matter experts to re-establish    historical standards of various existing certification programs to align    with best practices</p><p>    * Verify invoices on computer based testing activity</p><p>    Responsibilities:</p><p>    * Work experience as a psychometrician for one year</p><p>    * Advance degree in educational measurement, quantitative psychology,    statistics, or related field OR Undergraduate degree in statistics,    mathematics, computer science, psychology, or related field with 3 years'    experience as a psychometrician</p><p>    * Experience with subject matter expert groups</p><p>    * Experience designing testing programs</p><p>    * Experience with statistical analysis software</p><p>    * Able to travel occasionally to support activities</p><p>    * Foreign language skills (Spanish and Chinese) is an <script LANGUAGE="JavaScript"  type="text/javascript">
    //submits the form to send the email
    function submitForm() { 
    	if(_CF_checkmail_form(document.getElementById('mail_form'))){//function created by the coldfusion validation
    		document.getElementById("loading_email").style.visibility = 'visible';
			ColdFusion.Ajax.submitForm('mail_form', 'https://secure.jobappnetwork.com/jobappl/jobapps.cfm?job_id=1832504&pos=ManagerExam-Bank-and-Certification-Programs&loc=Miami-FL-US', mail_callback, mail_errorHandler); 
		}
	} 
	
	//If email was sent succesfully
	function mail_callback(text){ 
		document.getElementById("loading_email").style.visibility = 'hidden';
		alert('Email sent succesfully!'); 
		ColdFusion.Window.hide('mail_window')
	} 

	//If we had problems sending the email
	function mail_errorHandler(code, msg){
		alert(msg); 
		document.getElementById("loading_email").style.visibility = 'hidden';
		alert("We had problems sending your email. Please try again later."); 
	}
 
</script>

    <div id="logo"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.magicleap.com/"><img src="https://cdn.greenhouse.io/external_greenhouse_job_boards/logos/000/001/621/resized/OG-1200x630_3x.png?1506642419" alt="Og 1200x630 3x" width="143" height="75" /></a></div>

        </a>

      <h1 class='app-title'>Lead Product Quality Engineer </h1>
      <span class='company-name'>
        at Magic Leap, Inc.
      </span>

      

      <div class='location'>
        Plantation, FL
      </div>
</div>
    <div id="content" class="">
      <p><strong>Lead Product Quality Engineer</strong></p>
<p>Plantation, FL</p>
<p><strong>Company Description</strong></p>
<p>Magic Leap is an eclectic group of visionaries, rocket scientists, wizards, and gurus from the fields of film, robotics, visualization, software, computing, and user experience.</p>
<p>We are growing quickly, and this is the time to get on board and play a role in shaping the way people will be interacting with the world tomorrow.¬†</p>
<h3>Job Description</h3>
<p>In this role, you will have responsibility for the development and implementation of product quality management efforts to manufacture and scale one of the most innovative products in the world today. In this highly visible and highly hands-on role, you will enjoy the key decision making combined with the on-site hands-on problem solving at contract manufacturer sites that comes with owning the product quality engineering across Magic Leap products. Strong leadership, organizational, and interpersonal skills are essential to succeed in this role.¬†</p>
<p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Develop new quality tests and audits at full system level for high volume production at CM sites.</li>
<li>Generate Product Quality Plan (PQP). Develop Quality Sampling methodologies at full system level.</li>
<li>Establish Outgoing Quality Control (OQC) and Customer Quality Audit (CQA) processes at CM sites.</li>
<li>Serve as escalation point for product quality issues through development builds, and mass production. Lead the team in critical FA/CA on Mass Production blocker issues coming from quality audits.</li>
<li>Establish Quality Specifications at full system level, and Quality agreements with contract manufacturers.</li>
<li>Lead new product quality improvement forum.</li>
<li>Support Engineering and NPI teams during the product development period.</li>
<li>Conduct periodic reviews of Field/Factory Quality Data with CM partners.</li>
<li>Prepare OK-to-Ship documentation for new product launch</li>
<li>Support/Attend new product development builds</li>
<li>Communicate project status updates to various project stakeholders, including team members and executives within Magic Leap and contract manufacturers.</li>
<li>Manage and work with design and engineering teams to map out process development exercises, secure resources, secure FA in order to improve yield and commit to schedules in line with program goals.</li>
<li>Lead in process capability assessment activities for new products/processes, and provide input back into various cross-functional teams.</li>
<li>Facilitating the inputs from cross-functional teams for Ok-to-Ship</li>
<li>Statistical data analysis to provide risk assessment of system quality issues</li>
<li>Providing design input to improve product quality</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>Working closely with contract manufacturing partners to understand and resolve product quality related issues</li>
<li>Managing cross-functionally with many different teams to resolve reliability escalations.</li>
<li>Communicate quality updates to executives and senior management.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Qualifications:</h3>
<ul>
<li>Bachelor‚Äôs degree (minimum) in engineering, science or related discipline. Masters‚Äô Degree is preferred</li>
<li>Minimum 10 years of experience working in high-tech consumer electronics product quality engineering or manufacturing roles</li>
<li>Evidence of commercial awareness and understanding of business context when making recommendations. International experience is required.</li>
<li>Created problem solving experience is a must requirement.</li>
<li>Exceptional communication skills - verbal, written and presentations.</li>
<li>Ability to easily present complex situations / data and articulate effectively to executives. High level of ‚Äòexecutive presence‚Äô is required.</li>
<li>Hands-on experience in developing product quality plans and quality audits,</li>
<li>Hands-on experience in driving failure analysis and corrective actions and efforts.</li>
<li>Thorough understanding of product development procedures, electronic manufacturing and qualification processes and experience in mechanical, optical, electrical commodities is required.</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>Application of DOE (Design of Experiments), Statistical Process Control methods and theory, FMEA (Failure Modes and Effects Analysis)</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>Extensive knowledge of Statistical Process Control, Advanced Quality Planning, problem solving techniques and other quality systems</li>
<li>Finance/business background is a strong plus (understand cost drivers and ability to derive costs associated with managing quality)</li>
<li>Dynamic and ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude individual with the desire to work with a great team and product</li>
<li>This position requires up to ~50% domestic/international travel, with some trips lasting up to three weeks in duration.</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="title">Additional Information</h3>
<div class="wysiwyg">
<ul>
<li>All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines.</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div id="eeoc_fields">
  <strong>U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary)
</strong>

  <p>
  Individuals seeking employment at Magic Leap, Inc. are considered without regards
  to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical
  or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are
  being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us
  comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record
  keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.
</p>

<p>
  Completion of the form is entirely <strong>voluntary</strong>. Whatever your decision,
  it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you
  do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.
</p>


    
<div class="field" id="gender_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_gender">Gender</label>
  <select name="job_application[gender]" id="job_application_gender"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">Male</option>
<option value="2">Female</option>
<option value="3">Decline To Self Identify</option></select>
</div>    
<div class="field" id="hispanic_ethnicity_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_hispanic_ethnicity">Are you Hispanic/Latino?</label>
  <select name="job_application[hispanic_ethnicity]" id="job_application_hispanic_ethnicity"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="Yes">Yes</option>
<option value="No">No</option>
<option value="Decline To Self Identify">Decline To Self Identify</option></select>
</div>    
<div class="field" id="race_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_race">Please identify your race</label>
  <select name="job_application[race]" id="job_application_race"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">American Indian or Alaskan Native</option>

</div>
    <a target="_blank" href="https://boards-usw2-cdn.greenhouse.io/docs/RaceEthnicityDefinitions.pdf">
      Race &amp; Ethnicity Definitions
</a>
    <p>
  If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below,
  please indicate by making the appropriate selection.  As a government contractor
  subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this
  information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive
  recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected
  categories is as follows:
</p>

<p>
  A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground,
  naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of
  military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the
  Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active
  duty because of a service-connected disability.
</p>

<p>
  A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning
  on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S.
  military, ground, naval, or air service.
</p>

<p>
  An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active
  duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign
  or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws
  administered by the Department of Defense.
</p>

<p>
  An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active
  duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United
  States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant
  to Executive Order 12985.
</p>


    
<div class="field" id="veteran_status_dropdown_container">

  <select name="job_application[veteran_status]" id="job_application_veteran_status"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">I am not a protected veteran</option>
<option value="2">I identify as one or more of the classifications of a protected veteran</option>
<option value="3">I don&#39;t wish to answer</option></select>

    <div class="eeoc_form_data">
  <p>Form CC-305</p>
  <p>OMB Control Number 1250-0005</p>
  <p>Expires 1/31/2020</p>
</div>

<h3 id="disability_status_header">Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability</h3>

<strong>Why are you being asked to complete this form?</strong>

<p>
  Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide
  equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities<sup>1</sup>.  To help us
  measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or
  if you ever had a disability.  Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you
  will choose to fill it out.  If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be
  kept private and will not be used against you in any way.
</p>

<p>
  If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way.
  Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our
  employees to update their information every five years.  You may voluntarily
  self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment
  because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.
</p>

<strong>How do I know if I have a disability?</strong>
<p>
  You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or
  medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a
  history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.
</p>

<p>Disabilities include, but are not limited to:</p>
<ul>
  <li>Blindness</li>
  <li>Deafness</li>
  <li>Cancer</li>
  <li>Diabetes</li>
  <li>Epilepsy</li>
  <li>Autism</li>
  <li>Cerebral palsy</li>
  <li>HIV/AIDS</li>
  <li>Schizophrenia</li>
  <li>Muscular dystrophy</li>
  <li>Bipolar disorder</li>
  <li>Major depression</li>
  <li>Multiple sclerosis (MS)</li>
  <li>Missing limbs or partially missing limbs</li>
  <li>Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)</li>
  <li>Obsessive compulsive disorder</li>
  <li>Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair</li>
  <li>Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)</li>
</ul>


    
<div class="field" id="disability_status_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_disability_status">Disability Status</label>
  <select name="job_application[disability_status]" id="job_application_disability_status"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">Yes, I have a disability (or previously had a disability)</option>
<option value="2">No, I don&#39;t have a disability</option>
<option value="3">I don&#39;t wish to answer</option></select>
</div>
    <strong>Reasonable Accommodation Notice</strong>
<p>
  Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified
  individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation
  to apply for a job or to perform your job.  Examples of reasonable accommodation
  include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing
  documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using
  specialized equipment.
</p>

<p>
  <sup>1</sup>Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.  For more
  information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors,
  visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
  (OFCCP) website at <a href="http://www.dol.gov/ofccp"
  target="_blank">www.dol.gov/ofccp</a>.
</p>

<p>
  PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT:  According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons
  are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays
  a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.
</p>

</div>

(function IIFE(dataLayer) {
	var mySearchExperience = isSearch() ? "" : window.localStorage.getItem('search_algorithm');
    var searchAlgorithm = isSearchRelatedPage() ? mySearchExperience || 'none' : 'none';
    dataLayer.push({
            "talentNetworkDID": "TNHV0NZ6JLYRVGX9JC4H",
            "companyName": "Stryker",
            "clientCountry": "US",
            "template_ID": "premium",
            "search_experience": searchAlgorithm
    });
})(window.dataLayer);


function isSearch() {
    return window.location.href.match(/\/search/g)
}
function isSearchRelatedPage() {
    if(window.location.href.match(/\/job\//g)) {
        return document.referrer.match(/\/search/g);
    }

    return window.location.href.match(/\/search|\/ApplyFinish\//g)
}

Before providing any personal information to outside parties, please verify the following: A) all legitimate Stryker recruiter email addresses end with ‚Äú@stryker.com‚Äù and  B) the position described is found on our careers site at careers.stryker.com.</i></small>

        <!-- JDP Media Section-->

        </div>
        <!-- About Us -->

        </div>

    <!-- Left Column -->
    <div class="jdp-left-column col-md-8 col-md-pull-4">
        <!-- Job Description -->
        <div id="jdp-job-description-section">
            <div class="jdp-job-description-card content-card">
    <h2 class="content-card-header">Job Description</h2>
    The Sr Principal Engineer would be responsable of leading and facilitating the definition and continuous improvement of affordable hard tissue robotic spine surgical procedures and system configurations which provide health care providers worldwide with clinical solutions superior to all other available options in terms of predictable accuracy, ease of use, procedural speed, and indication applicability.<ul><li>Collaborate with Program Management in the creation of Product Development Plans and related schedules.</li><li>Lead competitive analysis in partnership with Marketing.</li><li>Collaborate with Marketing to define a long-term feature and function implementation strategy (a.k.a. ‚Äúroadmap‚Äù).</li><li>Lead development and selection of clinical arrangements and workflows, taking input from Health Care Providers, Marketing, Industrial Design, Usability Engineering, and Development Engineers.</li><li>Define surgical approaches based on Surgeon and Marketing input.</li><li>Lead development and selection of tool paths and poses.</li><li>Perform clinical performance analysis.</li><li>Establish clinical performance requirements based on customer requirements and technical capabilities.</li><li>Lead development of device functional architectures, taking input from Development Engineers.</li><li>Guide the development of device physical architecture interfacing with users, taking input from Development and Usability Engineers.</li><li>Oversee and approve usability analysis and realization.</li><li>Participate in risk management with all other development functional groups.</li><li>Facilitate surgeon cadaver labs and summarize results in reports and presentations.</li><li>Work with Test Engineering to develop and implement system validation plans and protocols.</li><li>Lead product validation, taking input from Marketing.</li><li>Lead the resolution of cross-cutting field issues.</li><li>Provide mentoring and advice to more junior employees on clinical, technical, process, and tool subjects.</li></ul>
</div>

        </div>
        <!-- Job Requirements -->
        <div id="jdp-job-requirements-section">
            <div class="jdp-job-requirements-card content-card">
    <h2 class="content-card-header">Job Requirements</h2>
    <ul><li>BS in engineering, technology, and/or science. Advanced degree preferred.</li><li>Ten (10) or more years of medical device development and/or spine clinical experience.</li><li>Experience with and knowledge of human spinal anatomy and/or spinal implants </li><li>Strong cross-functional leadership and collaboration abilities.</li><li>Experience with medical device product development and associated regulations.</li><li>Ability to set and maintain strategic direction and ensure detailed execution is consistent with the vision.</li><li>Effective oral and written communication abilities.</li><li>Product launch experience preferred.</li><li>Knowledge of statistical methods and expertise with statistical software tools.</li><li>Experience and skill in managing risk.‚Äã</li><li>Experience and skill in developing efficient qualification plans and protocols.‚Äã</li><li>Experience with Design of Experiments (DoE) preferred.‚Äã</li><li>Experience with structured problem solving preferred.‚Äã</li><li>Experience with structured decision analysis (trade studies) preferred.‚Äã</li><li>Experience working with orthopedic surgeons or neurosurgeons</li></ul>
</div>

        </div>

    function trackPage() {

                    _gat._anonymizeIp();
                }

                pageTracker._trackPageview();
            }
        }
        catch (error) {

        }
    }

                                <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
        "@context": "http://schema.org",
        "@type": "JobPosting",
        "datePosted": "2017-10-02",
        "description": "<p><strong>Automation Anywhere</strong></p><p><strong>Sales Engineer &ndash; Miami</strong></p><p><br /> <strong>Company Description:</strong></p><p>Automation Anywhere is a Silicon Valley-based software company that provides Robotic Process Automation and Cognitive solutions to clients.&nbsp; Forrester has ranked Automation Anywhere as the leader in this market, and the company has been and continues to undergo huge growth.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Sales Engineer Description:</strong></p><p>To meet market demand, we are seeking an enthusiastic, energetic, fast paced, high performing Sales Engineer who will work alongside our account managers to create and maintain long lasting customer relationships.&nbsp; The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in Sales Engineering, Professional Services, or Customer Support and be an outstanding communicator to business and technical users. A working knowledge of Robotic Process Automation or other automation tools is preferred.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>The most critical function of our Sales Engineers is the Proof of Concept in which they go onsite with an account manager and build bots live in front of the client. Proof of Concept includes the following responsibilities:<ul><li>Document the client&rsquo;s process and estimate efforts of proposed automation</li><li>Negotiate POC scope and success criteria with clients</li><li>Provide technical support for client installations including local (laptop) and virtual machine deployments and verification of test environments, access, data, etc. necessary to conduct POC</li><li>Build and test bots on-site in front of clients and answer questions throughout</li><li>Support account manager in preparation and presentation of POC results and demonstration</li><li>Debrief sales and record notes of client interactions and potential opportunities</li><li>Monitor and communicate deal status to ensure proper resourcing on POCs</li></ul></li><li>Participate in onsite and remote customer meetings in support of account managers to deliver custom product demos, answer technical Q&amp;A, engage in solutioning discussions and overcoming technical objections.</li><li>Prepare and maintain technical sales collateral to support discussions with client&rsquo;s enterprise architects, infrastructure and security teams.</li><li>Continuous Process Improvement &ndash; maintain documentation of processes and seek ways to improve operations</li><li>Requires 50-75% travel (United States with possible travel to Canada and Latin America)</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Required Experience:</strong></p><p>5+ years of experience in Enterprise Software serving Mid-Market to Large Enterprise clients in Presales / Sales Engineering, Customer Support, or Professional Services.</p><p>1+ years of experience with Robotic Process Automation or Business Process Automation preferred.&nbsp;</p><p>Bachelor&rsquo;s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.<br /><br />Fluent in English, Portuguese and Spanish - written and verbal</p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Technical Requirements:</strong></p><p>Experience, education, training, or knowledge should include:</p><ul><li>XML and SQL</li><li>Business process automation</li><li>Cloud and virtualization architecture and infrastructure (e.g., VMWare, AWS, Azure)</li><li>UI based and advance automation technologies (preferred, not required)</li><li>MS Office Products</li></ul><p><strong>Background Verification:</strong></p><p>Employment and background checks required.</p>",
        "hiringOrganization": "Automation Anywhere",
                    "employmentType": "Full-Time",

                <h2 class="jv-header">
                Sales Engineer
    
    </h2>
                                        <p class="jv-job-detail-meta">
                            Sales            <span class='jv-inline-separator'></span>
                    Miami,
                            Florida
                
                        </p>
        <hr />
    
                        <div class="jv-job-detail-top-actions">
                        
    <a class="jv-button jv-button-primary jv-button-apply" href="/automationanywhere/job/omC75fwU/apply">

                        <div class="jv-job-detail-description">
            <h3>Description</h3>
                        <p ng-non-bindable>
                <p><strong>Automation Anywhere</strong></p><p><strong>Sales Engineer &ndash; Miami</strong></p><p><br /> <strong>Company Description:</strong></p><p>Automation Anywhere is a Silicon Valley-based software company that provides Robotic Process Automation and Cognitive solutions to clients.&nbsp; Forrester has ranked Automation Anywhere as the leader in this market, and the company has been and continues to undergo huge growth.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Sales Engineer Description:</strong></p><p>To meet market demand, we are seeking an enthusiastic, energetic, fast paced, high performing Sales Engineer who will work alongside our account managers to create and maintain long lasting customer relationships.&nbsp; The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in Sales Engineering, Professional Services, or Customer Support and be an outstanding communicator to business and technical users. A working knowledge of Robotic Process Automation or other automation tools is preferred.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><p>&nbsp;</p><ul><li>The most critical function of our Sales Engineers is the Proof of Concept in which they go onsite with an account manager and build bots live in front of the client. Proof of Concept includes the following responsibilities:<ul><li>Document the client&rsquo;s process and estimate efforts of proposed automation</li><li>Negotiate POC scope and success criteria with clients</li><li>Provide technical support for client installations including local (laptop) and virtual machine deployments and verification of test environments, access, data, etc. necessary to conduct POC</li><li>Build and test bots on-site in front of clients and answer questions throughout</li><li>Support account manager in preparation and presentation of POC results and demonstration</li><li>Debrief sales and record notes of client interactions and potential opportunities</li><li>Monitor and communicate deal status to ensure proper resourcing on POCs</li></ul></li><li>Participate in onsite and remote customer meetings in support of account managers to deliver custom product demos, answer technical Q&amp;A, engage in solutioning discussions and overcoming technical objections.</li><li>Prepare and maintain technical sales collateral to support discussions with client&rsquo;s enterprise architects, infrastructure and security teams.</li><li>Continuous Process Improvement &ndash; maintain documentation of processes and seek ways to improve operations</li><li>Requires 50-75% travel (United States with possible travel to Canada and Latin America)</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Required Experience:</strong></p><p>5+ years of experience in Enterprise Software serving Mid-Market to Large Enterprise clients in Presales / Sales Engineering, Customer Support, or Professional Services.</p><p>1+ years of experience with Robotic Process Automation or Business Process Automation preferred.&nbsp;</p><p>Bachelor&rsquo;s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.<br /><br />Fluent in English, Portuguese and Spanish - written and verbal</p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Technical Requirements:</strong></p><p>Experience, education, training, or knowledge should include:</p><ul><li>XML and SQL</li><li>Business process automation</li><li>Cloud and virtualization architecture and infrastructure (e.g., VMWare, AWS, Azure)</li><li>UI based and advance automation technologies (preferred, not required)</li><li>MS Office Products</li></ul><p><strong>Background Verification:</strong></p><p>Employment and background checks required.</p>
            </p>
                            <p ng-non-bindable></p>
                    </div>

    <div id="main">
      


<div id='app_body' style='padding-left:20px'>
    <div id="logo"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.magicleap.com/"><img src="https://cdn.greenhouse.io/external_greenhouse_job_boards/logos/000/001/621/resized/OG-1200x630_3x.png?1506642419" alt="Og 1200x630 3x" width="143" height="75" /></a></div>

    <div id="header">
        <a href='#app' id='apply_button' class='button'>
          Apply Now
        </a>

      <h1 class='app-title'>Software Engineer (SDK &amp; Tools)</h1>
      <span class='company-name'>
        at Magic Leap, Inc.
      </span>

      

      <div class='location'>
        Plantation, FL
      </div>
</div>
    <div id="content" class="">
      <section class="job-section">
<h3 class="title">Company Description</h3>
<div class="wysiwyg">
<p>Magic Leap is an eclectic group of visionaries, rocket scientists, wizards, and gurus from the fields of film, robotics, visualization, software, computing, and user experience.</p>
<p>We are growing quickly, and this is the time to get on board and play a role in shaping the way people will be interacting with the world tomorrow.</p>
</div>
</section>
<section class="job-section">
<h3><strong>Job Description</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The primary responsibility of the software engineer is to produce deliverables within the agreed upon scope and schedule by the lead engineer in the team. Qualified candidates need to be a self-starter and able to operate in a highly dynamic environment.</span></p>
<h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Participate in the architecture and design effort for the SDK and Tools product</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Implement the assigned SDK &amp; Tools features on time with the highest quality</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Support overall engineering and architecture effort of the SDK &amp; Tools group</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Write elegant, maintainable, reusable code, leveraging test driven principles to develop high quality SDK &amp; Tools</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Troubleshoot and resolve software defects and other technical issues</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Participate in peer code reviews in the team</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Qualifications</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">3 to 5 years of proficient experience working on software products</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience in developing SDKs and developer tools in agile environment</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with API design and SDK architecture</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience in developers tools like emulators, debuggers, profilers etc</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Expert level C++ in a production environment</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Strong functional and automated testing, test strategy and planning and development experience</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with mobile software development</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Excellent problem solving, troubleshooting and debugging skills</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Must have familiarity with Android Open Source toolchains, techniques, and native libraries.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Must have familiarity with the Android application component model and embedded IPC mechanisms.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with OpenGL is nice-to-have</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with Vulkan Drivers is nice-to-have</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with Game Engines is nice-to-have</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Education</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">BA/BS is preferred</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Additional Information</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines.</span></p>
</section>
</div>

<div class="attach-or-paste " data-allow-s3="true" data-field="5" data-file-types="[]" data-model="job_application[attachments]">

  <div class="drop-zone hidden">

  <div id="5_chosen" class="chosen">
    <img src="https://boards-usw2-cdn.greenhouse.io/assets/file-72a3a725025753f50d86728a02b8b3aee9618285adc9237fc25674ef3e644548.png" alt="File" />&nbsp;&nbsp;

<div id="eeoc_fields">
  <strong>U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary)
</strong>

  <p>
  Individuals seeking employment at Magic Leap, Inc. are considered without regards
  to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical
  or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are
  being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us
  comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record
  keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.
</p>

<p>
  Completion of the form is entirely <strong>voluntary</strong>. Whatever your decision,
  it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you
  do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.
</p>


    
<div class="field" id="gender_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_gender">Gender</label>
  <select name="job_application[gender]" id="job_application_gender"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">Male</option>
<option value="2">Female</option>
<option value="3">Decline To Self Identify</option></select>
</div>    
<div class="field" id="hispanic_ethnicity_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_hispanic_ethnicity">Are you Hispanic/Latino?</label>
  <select name="job_application[hispanic_ethnicity]" id="job_application_hispanic_ethnicity"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="Yes">Yes</option>
<option value="No">No</option>
<option value="Decline To Self Identify">Decline To Self Identify</option></select>
</div>    
<div class="field" id="race_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_race">Please identify your race</label>
  <select name="job_application[race]" id="job_application_race"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">American Indian or Alaskan Native</option>
<option value="2">Asian</option>
<option value="3">Black or African American</option>

<option value="8">Decline To Self Identify</option></select>
</div>
    <a target="_blank" href="https://boards-usw2-cdn.greenhouse.io/docs/RaceEthnicityDefinitions.pdf">
      Race &amp; Ethnicity Definitions
</a>
    <p>
  If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below,
  please indicate by making the appropriate selection.  As a government contractor
  subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this
  information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive
  recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected
  categories is as follows:
</p>

<p>
  A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground,
  naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of
  military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the
  Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active
  duty because of a service-connected disability.
</p>

<p>
  A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning
  on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S.
  military, ground, naval, or air service.
</p>

<p>
  An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active
  duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign
  or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws
  administered by the Department of Defense.
</p>

<p>
  An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active
  duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United
  States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant
  to Executive Order 12985.
</p>


    
<div class="field" id="veteran_status_dropdown_container">
  <label for="job_application_veteran_status">Veteran Status</label>
  <select name="job_application[veteran_status]" id="job_application_veteran_status"><option value="">Please select</option><option value="1">I am not a protected veteran</option>
<option value="2">I identify as one or more of the classifications of a protected veteran</option>
<option value="3">I don&#39;t wish to answer</option></select>
